alert.note: Alert for Langlade; Lincoln (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 31 at 5:32AM CDT until April 01 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, freezing rain and snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. For the Winter Storm Watch, snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches and ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Langlade and Lincoln Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 7 AM CDT this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from this evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible tonight. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
